p: Decoupling could be categorized as either absolute decoupling or relative decoupling. In the first case, CO2 emissions decrease, while the real income increases (Freitas & Kaneko, 2011). In the second case, both CO2 emissions and real income increase, but the growth rate of CO2 emissions is considerably smaller than real income. As Rüstemoğlu (2019) demonstrated in a case study, Germany is an example of a country that achieved an absolute decoupling between CO2 emissions and real income, and this is an impressive result for sustainability targets.
